pages.text: Gigarimaneta samsoni hails from the Upper Ediacaran, with fossils found from Newfoundland, Canada. It is a lifeform comprised of many leaf-like shapes joined together on a central axis, and could grow up to around 60 cm overall, and possibly partook in filter feeding from the surrounding water.

The generic name derives from the Beothuk word 'gigarimanet', to mean 'net'. Its specific name derives from the surname of Edith Samson, a known Ediacaran Paleontologist who has done extensive research within the Newfoundland area.
